TopicTitle: KSP Wiki going live on Monday!

Articles.Content:
Yup, you heard right, the wiki is going Live on Monday, so feel free to help contribute as much as you can!

As a note, the forums rules apply to the wiki, breaching the rules on the wiki will net the user punishment on both the forums and the Wiki.

-DR
Cool. Time to spend no time IRL and all time in KSP and its forum and wiki.
When the wiki goes back up, can we add game guides to help new players out in whichever approach they wish to do?

When the wiki goes back up, can we add game guides to help new players out in whichever approach they wish to do?

Of course you can,
Sweet. I will also keep an updated list of available plugins and mods available.
So wait, how is spam going to be fought? Anyways, finally the wiki is up!
The mod team?
I think what he\'s worried about is that there will be, like there was before, too much spam for the moderation team to handle.
Yeah, hence having 14 mods and 4 global mods now,

Will this wiki be open for anyone to edit? If so I am strongly against it\'s re-opening.

People should have to request editing permissions unless we can tie it directly to the forum login. Anything else is going to result in a flood of automated spamming that will quickly turn it back into the cesspool it was before.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
We are going to tie it to forum log in, but not via an API, via an application for editing rights.

We are going to tie it to forum log in, but not via an API, via an application for editing rights.

Fair enough, let the wikiing (is that a word?) begin!

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
I am probably going to make some video tutorials if everybody is cool with that.
Lol it is now.and im very happy about this
I\'d like to contribute a page on orbital mechanics and how to apply them in-game. Even better, maybe some C# functions to go along with that.
Will updated pages from N3X1S\' version of the wiki be copied over?

Sorry guys, we\'ve got some technical issues to handle, so we\'re pushing back the go live for the wiki for another week. We\'ll keep you updated when we have these issues fixed.

-DR

Take your time, as long as it doesnt do like last time..

i once spent the 2 hours of boredom on the edit log, and i can tell you that this wiki was under assault every 3 minutes by a bot, who liked to replace existant pages with .. you don\'t want to know..

so, make it nice and secure right?
As the sys-op? That\'s my goal. I\'m working on several solutions at the moment, none of which are set in stone. I hope to have more news tomorrow.
For now, we\'ll have to push the wiki back another week. Sorry all.
Will fan material be allowed?

Will fan material be allowed?

Short Answer? No

Long Answer: Only after we have all the actual official information put up will I think about it.

-DR

The wiki is for factual game information. If you want to put fiction up, you have the Fan Fiction board.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
Skunky, would it be appropriate for us to post mods on the wiki or not?

Skunky, would it be appropriate for us to post mods on the wiki or not?

Yes, we will probably add a mods section to the wiki provided we have a way to keep it up to date.

Cheers!

Capt\'n Skunky

KSP Community Manager
